main event: On May 15, 1957, in San Angelo, Texas, a ground-visual observation of an unidentified flying object (UFO) was reported. The object moved across the sky at high speed, maintained a long distance, was silver in color, and round in shape. It moved rapidly in a straight course without oscillation or tail, and disappeared below the horizon without a change in speed.
interesting points: The UFO was observed for 2 minutes, indicating a sustained and prolonged sighting.
It moved rapidly in a straight course with no sign of regular aircraft characteristics.
The witness reported the object to be much larger than a Douglas Nike Ajax missile, indicating an unusual size.
No sound was heard from the UFO, contrary to typical aircraft observations.
The report included a witness sketch of the object's reported path and shape.
witnesses: The witness's details were not specifically mentioned in the provided text.
photographs: no, the report does not include photographs
